content:
There's a big blog post on the Bytecode Alliance blog today! https://bytecodealliance.org/articles/webassembly-the-updated-roadmap-for-developers

WebAssembly: An Updated Roadmap for Developers
The WebAssembly (Wasm) ecosystem is transforming. Developers can look forward to a modular, virtualizable, and robust environment for building applications, libraries, and services.We are excited to be working towards this with implement...

Very cool. As things are going, it looks like I will be adding a (more or less) full implementation of the wasi preview2 to wasm-bridge. Work has already started here, right now stream io and random are at least somewhat supported, clocks are coming next. Very exciting time to be working with wasm.

I just want to say a HUGE thank you to everyone that collaborated to pull together the an updated roadmap for WebAssembly:

https://bytecodealliance.org/articles/webassembly-the-updated-roadmap-for-developers and the associated youtube video. This was a huge amount of work and I hope that the community finds it helpful.

Now that we have a pattern out there, I hope we can provide more regular updates.

WebAssembly: An Updated Roadmap for Developers
The WebAssembly (Wasm) ecosystem is transforming. Developers can look forward to a modular, virtualizable, and robust environment for building applications, libraries, and services.We are excited to be working towards this with implement...
A message was moved here from #general > Roadmap by Liam Randall.
Thanks for all your work to make this happen!
@Kyle Brown THANK YOU! This current roadmap is a child of a child of a child of what you and Bailey were working on 6 months ago. So many people worked to pull this together.
:pray: Thank you for creating this excellent document and video material! I already forwarded the link to many groups which have potential interest in WebAssembly, both inside my company and AUTOSAR.
